alert.note: Alert for San Diego County Inland Valleys (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued February 10 at 2:40AM PST until February 10 at 4:00PM PST by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... ...HEAT ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Wind Warning, northeast winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts to 65 mph. For the Heat Advisory, temperatures up to 93 expected. * WHERE...San Diego County Valleys. Hottest temperatures in the western valleys. Strongest winds in the inland areas near the coastal slopes of the mountains. * WHEN...For the High Wind Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Heat Advisory, from 10 AM this morning to 4 PM PST this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds will blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Travel will be difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. Hot temperatures may cause heat illnesses to occur.
info.instruction: Use caution if you must drive. Drink plenty of fluids and stay out of the sun. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible.
